basics.name: Robin Bretin
basics.label: PhD, HCI/HRI Researcher
basics.summary: A French-born, curiosity-driven individual whose nature led them to become a researcher.

work.name: University of Glasgow, Glasgow, United Kingdom
work.summary: Conducted research on Human-Drone Interactions, focusing on Human-Drone proxemics and social drone design.
highlights: Designed and conducted in-person and VR-based user studies, employing Unity, C#, and DJI drone programming.
Presented published work at international conferences, including CHI and INTERACT.
Reviewed papers for CHI, HRI, CSCW, THRI, and ISMAR; served as 1AC for CHI LBW track.

work.name: Armed Forces Biomedical Research Institute (IRBA), Brétigny-sur-Orge, France
work.summary: Conducted ergonomic inspections of the VICTEAMS VR prototype.
highlights: Investigated gaze-based interaction designs and collected data in VR environments.
Contributed to improving virtual environments for team-based training scenarios.

work.name: SNCF/Human Design Group, Paris, France
work.summary: Developed a methodology to assess human reliability in train conductor functions for the Autonomous Train project.
highlights: Collaborated with train conductors and presented findings to clients.

work.name: Chalmers University of Technology, Goteborg, Sweden
work.summary: Explored big data, Game Design and 3D modeling during a culturally enriching exchange program.

education.institution: University of Glasgow, Glasgow, United Kingdom
education.summary: Thesis titled 'Beyond Boundaries: Unveiling Human-Drone Proxemic Dynamics Using Virtual Reality.'

education.institution: École Nationale Supérieure de Cognitique (ENSC), Bordeaux, France
education.summary: Specialized in cognitive engineering, with training in human factors, artificial intelligence, and human-computer interaction.

education.institution: La Prépa des INP, Grenoble, France
education.summary: Intensive foundational studies preparing for competitive entrance exams to French Grandes Écoles.

education.institution: Lycée Notre-Dame du Roc, La Roche-sur-Yon, France
education.summary: Graduated with highest honors (Mention Très Bien).

awards.title: IFIP TC13 Pioneers' Award for Best Doctoral Student Paper
awards.summary: Recognized for exceptional contribution to doctoral research in Human-Computer Interaction.

references.name: Dr. Mohamed Khamis
references.reference: Robin is truly an exceptional researcher and I highly recommend them for any position where innovative thinking, collaborative skills, and research excellence are valued! I would have hired him if I had vacant positions!
